title: Table
description: HTML tables allow web developers to arrange data into rows and columns.

body.raw:
# Creating Tables on a Website

7–8 MIN READ

## Learning Objectives
1. Differentiate the data table from the layout table. 1. Use the `` and `
` elements in a web page. 1. Create a borderless table for a horizontal navigation bar with text links. 1. Design tables using partition elements like `` and ``. 1. Create tables in a web page that span cells using rowspan and colspan attributes. 1. Improve the appearance of table using additional CSS propertie.
### Data Tables vs Layout Tables - **Data tables** very often holds numbers, but they can hold text and other types of content as well. - **Layout tables** are not limited to holding data - they are allowed to hold any type of content. Their purpose is to position that content with a row-column layout scheme.
### Example of Data Table
### Example Layout Tables
### Table Elements - An HTML table is defined with the `` and `
` tags. - Each table row is defined with the `` and `` tags. - A table header is defined with the `` and `` tags. - By default, table headers are **bold** and **centered**. - A table data or cell is defined with the `` and `` tags.
### Students List Web page
### Formatting a Data Table - **border-style**: use to specify a table border - **border-width**: use to specify the border’s width - **border**: a shorthand property that handles a set of border-related properties - **padding**: use to specify the space between the cell content and its border - **border-collapse**: use to collapse borders into just one border
### Students List Web Page With Border Property ```CSS {2} showLineNumbers table, td, tr { border: thin solid; } ```
### Students List Web Page With Border-collapse Property ```CSS {2} showLineNumbers table, td, tr { border-collapse: collapse; } ```
### The thead and tbody Elements - **thead**: used to group header content in an HTML table - **tbody**: used to group the body content in an HTML table.
### Students List Web Page With Head and Tbody Elements ``` CSS {1,5} showLineNumbers thead { background-color: midnightblue; } tbody { background-color: lightblue; } ``` #### Complete Code ```HTML {23, 28} showLineNumbers HTML Table
Student Name Student Number Age
Juan Dela Cruz 2021-21067 18
Pedro Cruise 2021-21114 19
Simon Ibarra 2021-21584 18
``` #### Output
### Cell Spanning - **colspan** : defines the number of columns a table cell should span. - **rowspan** : specifies the number of rows a cell should span.
### Students List Web Page With Border-collapse Property ```HTML showLineNumbers Assignments Laboratory Ability to Stay Awake ``` #### Complete code ```HTML showLineNumbers HTML Table
Assignments Laboratory Ability to Stay Awake
1 2 3 1 2
10% 10% 10% 30% 36% 4%
``` #### Output
### Table Size - The size of the table is define using **width** and **height** properties.
### Table Alginment - The **text-align** property is used to set the horizontal alignment of the content in `` and `` elements. - The **vertical-align** property sets the vertical alignment of the content in `` and ``. - The value for **vertical-align** property can be **top**, **bottom**, or **middle**.
### Horizontal Dividers - Use the **border-bottom** property to `` and `` for horizontal dividers.
### Hoverable Table - Use the **:hover** selector on `` to highlight table rows on mouse over.
## Summary Table | Element | Definition | |---------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | [``](#table-elements) | Defines the table element. | | [``](#table-elements) | Defines a table row. | | [``](#the-thead-and-tbody-elements)| Use to group header content in an HTML Table. | | [``](#the-thead-and-tbody-elements)| Use to group the body content in an HTML Table. |
| Attributes | Definition | |-----------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | [`colspan`](#cell-spanning) | Defines the number of columns a table cell should span. | | [`rowspan`](#cell-spanning) | Specifies the number of rows a cell should span. |
| Styles | Definition | |----------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | [`border-style`](#formatting-a-data-table) | Use to specify the table border. | | [`border-width`](#formatting-a-data-table) | Use to specify the border’s width. | | [`border`](#formatting-a-data-table) | A shorthand property that handles a set of border-related properties. | | [`padding`](#formatting-a-data-table) | Use to specify the space between the cell content and its border. | | [`border-collapse`](#formatting-a-data-table)| Use to collapse border into just one border. | | [`text-align`](#table-alignment) | Use to set the horizontal alignment of the content `
` to highlight table rows on mouse over. |
### Credits This webpage was created based on lessons provided by **Rose Anne G. Cochanco** as part of Web Development subject. The table example is sourced from shadcn/ui.
